database.name: MetabolomicsWorkbench
database.description: The Metabolomics Workbench will serve as a national and international repository for metabolomics data and metadata and will provide analysis tools and access to metabolite standards, protocols, tutorials, training, and more.

entry.name: NMR based metabolomics of CKD
entry.description: The goal of this study is to find metabolomic signatures that differentiate controls, defined as having normal kidney function with eGFR > 60 and absence of microalbuminuria (ACR< 30 g/mg) and those with chronic kidney disease (CKD) defined as having eGFR < 60. The CKD group was further differentiated into groups by microalbuminaria ACR<30-200, 200-1000, or >1000. Both groups will be further characterized into high (>65 mEq/day) or low (<30 mEq/day) dietary acid load which is calculated as net endogenous acid production (NEAP) which is a suspected negative modulator of kidney function. THe study set consists of 49 subjects in the CKD group, 50 subjects in the control group and 9 pooled samples. Some of the control and CKD samples were examined at a followup visit and assesesd as to progression or not for kidney disease.

Bruker Avance III
